Remerge is an Equal Opportunity Employer: all qualified applicants are considered for positions regardless of race, ethnic origin, gender, age, religion or belief, marital status, gender identification, sexual orientation, veteran status or disability. We're looking forward to your application!

Title: Staff Data Scientist - Ad Tech (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

Be our next Hero! - Join the world’s leading local delivery platform.

We are looking for Staff Data Scientists (all genders) to join the Ad Tech data science team in our mission to deliver consistently amazing experiences.

You will be a thought leader, driving innovation by designing and deploying our models to the forefront of technology to solve complex problems, delivering revenue for Delivery Hero at the frontline of our growth & profitability journey.

At Delivery Hero, AdTech introduces people to new food they love and enables our partners to meet their future customers at the perfect moment. We have developed a range of products to offer advertising solutions for restaurants helping them to increase their visibility and reach, improve their order conversion, and eventually drive more sales by covering the entire marketing funnel. Operating across over 50 countries around the clock, our Ad Tech connects the ideal advertiser with the ideal customer millions of times every day. In 2024/25, Ad Tech is a fundamental area for us on our path to profitability and is predicted to generate more than 1 billion euros in revenue for Delivery Hero; our data science team is at the heart of this growth, powering personalisation, relevance, and recommendation.

The Ad Tech data science team operates within the wider Vendor Data tribe whose mission is to drive innovation, insight-driven decision making and to solve business problems through a culture of excellence and openness. The tribe comprises teams of skilled analysts, engineers, and scientists working together to deliver data solutions covering a host of business opportunities across all of Delivery Hero’s 70+ markets.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:


Spearhead a revolution of Ad Tech at Delivery Hero through the innovative application of cutting edge tools and techniques such as neural networks and reinforcement learning covering areas such as ad ranking, bidding strategies, and ad pacing driving unparalleled improvements in advertising campaigns.
Analyse large-scale datasets to understand and identify opportunities deploying sophisticated statistical techniques to improve ad relevance, click-through rates, and conversion metrics.
Lead research initiatives to explore emerging trends and technologies in AdTech and machine learning, contributing to the advancement of Delivery Hero's advertising products and algorithms. Remain at the forefront of industry and research developments incorporating new methodologies and best practices into our data science workflows and models.
Serve as a subject matter expert in data science and machine learning, providing guidance and mentorship to other team members and fostering a culture of continuous learning and innovation within the data science team.


What you need to be successful


You are an industry-leading talent at modelling business problems using machine learning techniques covering feature engineering, model selection and design as well as evaluation and optimisation to deliver enormous value to the business.
You raise the performance of other team members through effective and mature mentorship and constructive collaboration to benefit others from your deep understanding and experience of data science.
You have extensive expertise in building and training complex neural network models with strong knowledge of the Python data toolkit centering around deep learning i.e. Keras and ideally Tensorflow and TFX
Through the seamless use of SQL queries you are able to explore our data universe and gather data to support your analysis and the development of machine learning solutions.
You write clean, production-level code and are able to effectively set up your environment to minimise testing loops influencing the entire team to work more efficiently and reliably.
You are familiar with deploying and developing complex neural networks to serve live traffic and experience collaborating with ML engineers in cloud systems, ideally GCP.
You love to learn, are a critical thinker and creative problem solver who strives for excellence.
You are a team player who loves to collaborate and work with stakeholders from a variety of teams in a diverse environment.


Nice to have:


Implementing neural networks to specifically solve Ad Tech challenges would be highly desirable.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Investment Modeling
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our Investment Modeling team to build quantitative growth models and optimise investments across hundreds of cities around the world!

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 50+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building forecasting models to predict the short and long-term impact of incentives on growth of the business. You will use an optimization techniques to distribute incentives over time periods, across different cities and channels to maximize the growth of the business. As a Data Scientist you will be building products powered by Data Science models for internal teams to use in portfolio planning and budgeting. In addition you will work on decomposing and modeling business growth by interpretable and actionable components

Your daily adventures will include:


Develop a deep understanding of technical and business needs to solve real-world problems end-to-end
Research, test and apply novel forecasting techniques and methods
Develop and maintain predictive models to ensure accurate forecasts at short and long horizons for multiple business verticals
Quickly deploy models to production using AWS and internal machine learning platform
Solve optimization problems for incentives budget allocation within local and global constraints.
Communicate and present results to product and business stakeholders
Work with Python, Spark, Presto, Docker, SageMaker, Airflow
Work with data analysts, data scientists, product managers and software engineers in cross-functional feature teams
Regularly exchange knowledge with Data Scientists at various levels of seniority in the company



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (3+ years recommended)
Natural curiosity to identify problems, explore trends and discover opportunities with little supervision
Capability to approach problems with first principles thinking
Team player with strong verbal and written communication skills in English
Experience in time series analysis, modeling multivariate time series, familiarity with forecasting techniques
Experience in Python programming, including libraries like Pandas, Numpy, sklearn, OR-tools
Understanding and practical experience with statistical hypothesis testing
You will get extra credits for product development experience in a technology company
You will get extra credits for Ph.D in a quantitative field (physics, mathematics, computer science, economics)
You will get extra credits for an experience with multivariate time series forecasting methods



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.
Show more

Title: Python Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission

Als Python Backend Developer (m/w/d) bei SIDES sind Sie verantwortlich für das Design, die Implementierung und die Wartung von Backend-Systemen und APIs mit Python. Ihre Expertise in FastAPI und SQLAlchemy wird entscheidend sein, um skalierbare und leistungsstarke Anwendungen zu entwickeln, die ein nahtloses Benutzererlebnis bieten. Sie werden eng mit unseren Frontend Entwicklern, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern zusammenarbeiten, um robuste und effiziente Lösungen bereitzustellen.

Hauptaufgaben:


Design, Entwicklung und Wartung von Backend-Diensten und APIs mit Python
Zusammenarbeit mit Frontend-Entwicklern zur Integration von Benutzeroberflächenelementen mit serverseitiger Logik
Sicherstellung der Leistung, Qualität und Reaktionsfähigkeit der Anwendungen
Implementierung von Sicherheits- und Datenschutzprotokollen
Schreiben von sauberem, wartbarem und gut dokumentiertem Code
Durchführung von Code-Reviews und konstruktives Feedback an Teammitglieder
Fehlerbehebung und Debugging von Anwendungen zur Sicherstellung optimaler Leistung
Auf dem neuesten Stand der Branchentrends, Technologien und Best Practices bleiben
Teilnahme an agilen Entwicklungsprozessen, einschließlich Sprint-Planung, Daily Stand-ups und Retrospektiven



Your profile

Erforderliche Fähigkeiten und Qualifikationen:


Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einem verwandten Bereich oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung
Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Python-Entwickler, insbesondere in der Backend-Entwicklung (5+ Jahre)
Starke Kenntnisse der Programmiersprache Python.Erfahrung mit Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL, MySQL, REDIS, DynamoB)
Vertrautheit mit RESTful APIs und Webservices
Verständnis für asynchrone Programmierung und ereignisgesteuerte Architektur
Kenntnisse in Containerisierung und Bereitstellung mit Docker
Erfahrung mit Versionskontrollsystemen, insbesondere Git
Ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit, sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team zu arbeiten
Hervorragende Kommunikations- und Kollaborationsfähigkeiten
Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil, um effektiv mit unserem deutschsprachigen Team und unseren Kunden zu kommunizieren



Bevorzugte Fähigkeiten:


Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud
Erfahrung mit FastAPI, SQLAlchemy und ORM
Vertrautheit mit CI/CD-Pipelines und Tools wie Jenkins, Travis CI oder GitLab CI
Kenntnisse in Frontend-Technologien wie JavaScript, HTML und CSS
Erfahrung mit dem Schreiben von Unit-Tests
Erfahrung mit JIRA
Vertrautheit mit Microservices-Architektur und serverlosem Computing



Perks & Benefits

Was du von uns erwarten kannst:


A recipe for success: Wir sind dieses Jahr 10 Jahre alt geworden und sind als Spezialisten in der Gastronomie/Lieferindustrie bekannt. Mit SIDES repräsentierst du einen führenden Akteur auf diesem Gebiet.
Add ownership: Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dein Talent und deine Ideen zu formen. Du hast Freiheit und Verantwortung in deiner täglichen Arbeit innerhalb deines Teams.
High-quality work equipment: Du erhältst erstklassige Ausrüstung, um deine Arbeit erfolgreich auszuführen. Im Büro erwarten dich moderne Geräte und ausreichend Platz für angenehme Interaktionen mit dem SIDES-Team.
Hungry for growth: Persönliches Wachstum und kontinuierliches Lernen haben bei uns oberste Priorität. Wir führen regelmäßige Feedback-Zyklen durch, bieten dir Möglichkeiten zur Teilnahme an Seminaren, Workshops und Kongressen.
Perks:
Firmenrabatte (CorporateBenefits), Zugang zu mehreren Mitarbeiterrabatten
Rabatt auf eine Fitnessstudio-Mitgliedschaft
E-Learning-Möglichkeiten
Mental Health-App-Einrichtung: InstaHelp
Snacks und Getränke im Büro

Baking a positive workplace: Dich erwartet ein fantastisches, perfekt vernetztes Büro im Herzen von Berlin (Schöneberg). Klingt genau nach dem, was du gesucht hast? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestem Eintrittstermin.

Title: Founding Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We are seeking a talented and driven Machine Learning Engineer to join an exciting AI start-up. As a Founding Machine Learning Engineer, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing innovative AI solutions to revolutionise regulatory affairs. You will have the opportunity to work in a fast-paced environment from the early stages, contributing to the creation of groundbreaking products.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop and deploy machine learning models.
Design and implement scalable and efficient algorithms for data processing and analysis.
Utilize Python to develop and maintain machine learning pipelines.
Solve complex technical problems and make critical decisions on prioritising speed and attention to detail.
Continuously research and stay updated on the latest advancements in machine learning technologies.




Requirements:

Proven experience as a Machine Learning Engineer with proficiency in Python.
Demonstrated ability to build innovative products in a fast-paced environment, preferably from the early stages.
Exceptional problem-solving skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively.
Strong belief in our mission to revolutionise the regulatory affairs industry with AI.




Why Join Us:

Be at the forefront of transforming regulatory affairs with AI technology.
Opportunity to have a significant impact and drive meaningful change in the industry.
Work in a small and ambitious team where everyone has real ownership over the product and company.
Continuous growth and learning opportunities.
Competitive compensation package with an unusual amount of equity reserved for early, full-time employees.

Show more

  • Competitive compensation package with an unusual amount of equity reserved for early, full-time employees.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music company worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era. We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin.

What You'll Be Doing


Implement and Deploy ML Models: Implement, and deploy machine learning models, utilizing a variety of modeling approaches to address different business problems
Advanced ML Techniques: Implement systems with Generative AI (GenAI) and emerging architectures like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG)
Scalable Training Solutions: Scale training processes across multiple GPUs, leveraging state-of-the-art frameworks such as NVIDIA's cuDNN and TensorRT
Support AI and ML Pipelines: Assist various teams in deploying AI and ML pipelines on Google Cloud using Vertex AI, ensuring robust and scalable solutions
Automated ML Pipelines: Design and implement automated machine learning pipelines, including fully automated training and prediction processes
MLOps Best Practices: Apply MLOps best practices for model deployment, monitoring, and automation, enhancing the efficiency and reliability of ML operations
Containerization: Work with containerization technologies to streamline the deployment and management of ML models
Infrastructure-as-Code: Implement infrastructure-as-code using Terraform to ensure reproducible and scalable ML environments
Innovation and Problem-Solving: Apply strong problem-solving skills and creative thinking to champion the adoption of AI technologies that address business needs
Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams, demonstrating excellent communication and teamwork skills in a fast-paced environment


What You Bring


Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related field
Strong proficiency in Python and experience with deep learning frameworks, particularly PyTorch
In-depth understanding of various modeling approaches, Generative AI, and emerging architectures like Retrieval-Augmented Generation
Solid understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience with cloud platforms, preferably Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
Familiarity with MLOps best practices and tools for model deployment, monitoring, and automation
Experience working with containerization technologies and container registries
Proficiency in designing and implementing automated machine learning pipelines
Experience with infrastructure-as-code, preferably Terraform
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions
Excellent communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment


It's also a plus if you have...


Hands-on experience with scaling training processes across multiple GPUs, using frameworks like NVIDIA cuDNN and TensorRT
A understanding of cloud security practices and data compliance protocols
Experience in leading initiatives for academic collaboration and community engagement.


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, discounts for Bertelsmann employees etc.
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team


This Is Us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, colour, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

Title: Data Scientist - Natural Language Processing (NLP) (w/m/d) - hybrides Arbeiten (Remote & Präsenz)
Description:
Akkodis - entstanden durch den Zusammenschluss von AKKA & Modis - ist ein weltweit führendes Unternehmen im Bereich Engineering & IT. Als globaler Partner in einer sich ständig verändernden Technologie- & Wettbewerbsumgebung unterstützen wir unsere Kunden mit unserem 360°-Angebot dabei, eine nachhaltigere & smartere Zukunft zu gestalten. Vereint durch unsere gemeinsame Leidenschaft für Technologie & Talente betrachten wir die Welt aus einem neuen Blickwinkel. Unsere 50.000 motivierten Ingenieur:innen & Digitalexpert:innen gehen dabei täglich über das Mögliche hinaus, um Unglaubliches zu schaffen

Dann suchen wir Dich für ein Projekt unseres Kunden - ab sofort.

Deine Aufgaben



Du kannst bereits erste Berufserfahrung in der Analyse komplexer Daten aus unterschiedlichen Quellen mittels Natural Language Processing (NLP) Modellen, Computer Vision, Machine Learning vorweisen
Du wirkst an der Weiterentwicklung KI-basierter Lösungen zur automatisierten Erkennung, Interpretation und Verarbeitung von Audio-Video Materialien mit
Du erschließt neue Informationen und Zugänge zu bisher nicht nutzbaren Daten. Dazu evaluierst Du neue Technologien und entwickelst MVPs bis hin zum Einsatz ins Live-System
Du wirkst an der Weiterentwicklung KI-basierter Lösungen (Algorithmen)




Was Du dafür mitbringst



Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes (Fach-) Hochschulstudium im Bereich Informatik oder vergleichbare Qualifikation
Gute Erfahrung in Natural Language Processing angewandt auf nicht-wissenschaftliche Datensätze
Erfahrung mit manuellen und automatisiserten Methoden auf Textbausteine/-elemente (Algorithmen)
Erfahrung mit Pytorch, Tensorflow und/oder einem anderen gängigen DL-Framework
Erfahrung mit mindestens einem Python-API-Framework
Nice-to-have: Erfahrung im Umgang mit Machine Learning, AWS, Git und Docker
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse




Was Dich erwartet



Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil remote zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.

Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.

10789 Berlin

Title: Data Analytics Scientist (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. The Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision Science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

As a Data Scientist at Billie, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience that requires a good mix of technical and stakeholder engagement skills. As part of the Analytics team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, owning the business outcome, rather than just doing yet another analytics or data science role.

This is a unique opportunity for data scientists who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of the fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

What will you do?


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Find patterns in huge amounts of data
Support product segments in asking the right questions and creating efficient solutions that deliver positive results
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Build ML models to solve real business problems, and work closely with MLOps and Engineering teams to bring them live
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data science, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist (ML/DS Platform Team)
Description:
Craft:

Data, Analytics & Strategy

Job Description:

Senior Data Scientist - Machine Learning Platform / Data Science Platform Team

We are open for this role to be based in one of our sweet locations in either:


Stockholm
Malmö
Barcelona
London
Berlin


About The Role

King makes great games that offer fun, bite-size entertainment experiences for everyone to enjoy.

We are looking for an experienced data scientist to join our Data Science Platform team, which is part of the Machine Learning platform organization. The team consists of a mix of very experienced data scientists and ML Engineers / developers. The team's main focus is providing data scientists in the game teams at King with efficient and reliable tooling to boost their productivity, as well as catering to the explorative phases of building machine learning models. We have a tight collaboration with other teams in the ML organization which have responsibility for the later phases of the machine learning life-cycle.

One of the team’s main product is an internal Notebook platform built on top of the open source Jupyter projects, but extended and customized to integrate with other internal tooling, but also to help data scientists establish good workflows for other aspects of their job, such a CI/CD solutions when building internal packages, training on standard methodologies inside King etc.

We are looking for a great teammate who wants to help to empower our user base, which is counted in the hundreds of users, both by hands on building solutions but also identifying what recommended workflows should be.

We strive to not reinvent the wheel but rather to use existing open source and commercial products when possible, but often also need to write code to properly integrate both internal and external solutions in an effective manner for our users.

Skills To Create Thrills


Good understanding and hands-on experience with Python
Good understanding of the day to day life of a Data Scientist / ML Engineer
DevOps experience, such as CI/CD solutions and infrastructure as code
Knowledge in how to write services and create reusable libraries
Self-starter with a great drive and a curious and inquisitive mind-set
Willing to step outside your comfort zone to broaden your skills and learn new technologies
Highly collaborative work style and open to share your knowledge, receiving and giving feedback, performing code reviews and so on
You will need to be able to work independently on complex problems and be able to clearly communicate your ideas and solutions.




Knowledge in R
Experience writing plugins/extensions for JupyterLab
SQL and query optimization skills and good understanding of data modeling techniques
Containerizing workloads and running these on Kubernetes (GKE)
Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch or any other ML framework
Experience with ZenML and/or MLFlow
Google Cloud Platform including BigQuery or experience with other cloud computing provider


About King

At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?

Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.

So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com
Show more

The team's main focus is providing data scientists in the game teams at King with efficient and reliable tooling to boost their productivity, as well as catering to the explorative phases of building machine learning models. We have a tight collaboration with other teams in the ML organization which have responsibility for the later phases of the machine learning life-cycle.

One of the team’s main product is an internal Notebook platform built on top of the open source Jupyter projects, but extended and customized to integrate with other internal tooling, but also to help data scientists establish good workflows for other aspects of their job, such a CI/CD solutions when building internal packages, training on standard methodologies inside King etc.

We are looking for a great teammate who wants to help to empower our user base, which is counted in the hundreds of users, both by hands on building solutions but also identifying what recommended workflows should be.

We strive to not reinvent the wheel but rather to use existing open source and commercial products when possible, but often also need to write code to properly integrate both internal and external solutions in an effective manner for our users.

Skills To Create Thrills

  • Good understanding and hands-on experience with Python
  • Good understanding of the day to day life of a Data Scientist / ML Engineer
  • DevOps experience, such as CI/CD solutions and infrastructure as code
  • Knowledge in how to write services and create reusable libraries
  • Self-starter with a great drive and a curious and inquisitive mind-set
  • Willing to step outside your comfort zone to broaden your skills and learn new technologies
  • Highly collaborative work style and open to share your knowledge, receiving and giving feedback, performing code reviews and so on
  • You will need to be able to work independently on complex problems and be able to clearly communicate your ideas and solutions.



  • Knowledge in R
  • Experience writing plugins/extensions for JupyterLab
  • SQL and query optimization skills and good understanding of data modeling techniques
  • Containerizing workloads and running these on Kubernetes (GKE)
  • Experience with TensorFlow, PyTorch or any other ML framework
  • Experience with ZenML and/or MLFlow
  • Google Cloud Platform including BigQuery or experience with other cloud computing provider

About King

At King, we're Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We're the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world's most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren't just crushing it with candies, we're also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was acquired by Microsoft.

A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes

King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.

Making the World Playful

Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?

Kingsters are seriously playful: creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.

So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.

Applications need to be in English.

Discover King at careers.king.com

Title: Head of Data Science (all genders)
Description:
Are you ready to take the helm of a data science team at the forefront of Customer Relationship Management (CRM) at Zalando, Europe's leading fashion platform? We are looking for a Head of Data Science to join our CRM powerhouse being in charge for state-of-the-art scientific solutions in the field.

About The Role

In this pivotal position, you'll be steering multiple teams dedicated to crafting data-driven strategies that reasonate with millions and convert intent into long-term customer relation. Your domain will be the whole spectrum of helping to drive customer activation, engagement, retention, and lifetime.

You will guide measuring effectiveness, and developing innovative solutions to optimize CRM-related performance, where you'll apply your mastery of machine learning, predictive models, optimization algorithms, experimentation and causal inference to drive success in our significant marketing investments. Acting as the bridge between Software/Data Engineering and Data Analytics, you will be accountable for defining best-practices and repeatable solutions to speed up experimentation of complex research plans at department level. Together with other (senior) leaders and principal engineers/scientists in your department, you will facilitate the delivery of complex opportunities by guiding collaboration between different teams and presenting insights about status and challenges. You will also take ownership of the results of your department by defining technical ways to ensure that new and existing data-driven capabilities developed in multiple product areas continue to deliver value.


WHO YOU ARE?


Embarking on a journey to redefine the nexus of data science and customer relationship management, we are in search of an exceptional leader. Here's who you are in the landscape of our ambitious mission



Scientific Leader You are a visionary with a passion for guiding teams through the frontier of data science in CRM. With a Master's or PhD in a quantitative field, your leadership is informed by deep technical knowledge and strategic thinking.
Leading Leaders Having at least 3 years experience in leading leaders, you are adept at managing diverse teams, and at fostering an environment where machine learning, econometrics, and experimentation are leveraged to drive business outcomes.
Collaboration Champion You excel at fostering synergistic partnerships, working cohesively with product teams, engineers, and marketing professionals, alongside senior and principal scientists, to steer the team towards a shared vision and unified goals.
Catalyst for Innovation With a track record of empowering teams, you encourage ownership and continuous innovation, translating scientific rigor into tangible solutions that propel the business forward.
Business Savvy You bring a robust understanding of business operations, particularly within customer relationship management, and use this to guide your team through organizational challenges towards clear, department-aligned goals.




WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED




Mentor other data scientists, review and guide their work, help develop roadmaps for the team and be a role model for them.
Keep the team up-to-date with the latest research in causal inference methods.
Provide egoless constructive scientific feedback to peers and coach team members to become great researchers.
Contribute to and improve team and company processes that ensure high quality research through documentation, peer review, and structured feedback.



What We Are Looking For



Ph.D. in quantitative fields, computer science, statistics, or other quantitative science fields with an emphasis on computational research methods. Demonstrated experience to manage an industrial research project for at least 5 years.
Experience applying advanced causal identification research methods (experimental and/or quasi-experimental design).
Strong general scientific problem solving skills. Thinks strategically, but also stays on top of tactical execution.
As a self-starter, you drive results and have the ability to communicate relevant analytical insights from data to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Demonstrated ability to mentor other scientists. Strong sense of ownership, urgency and drive.




Why Join Us?




You'll be a key player in a department that's a driving force behind Zalando's growth.
You'll have access to cutting-edge infrastructure and massive datasets.
You will build leading solutions to form and optimize state-of-the-art CRM products and processes
Your work will blend scientific rigor with real-world business impact, celebrated globally.
You'll shape the future of marketing as Zalando transforms into The Starting Point for Fashion.




Perks at Work




Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback, open source commitment, meetups, 70+ internal technical and fun guilds, knowledge sharing through tech talks, internal tech academy and blogs , product demos, parties & events
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Extensive onboarding, mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)



We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

About Zalando

Zalando is Europe’s leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, connecting customers, brands and partners across 17 markets. We drive digital solutions for fashion, logistics, advertising and research, bringing head-to-toe fashion to more than 35+ million active customers through diverse skill-sets, interests and languages our teams choose to use.

Please note that all the applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via e-mail.


Ready to Lead, Inspire, and Innovate?


Apply now and join us on this exhilarating journey where your work will not only be seen but felt across the fashion industry and beyond.

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Fraud & Credit Risk (m/f/d)
Description:
About the job




Ratepay is a leading financial technology company specializing in providing innovative payment solutions for online businesses. With a mission to simplify payment processes and enhance the shopping experience for customers, Ratepay empowers merchants to optimize their payment strategies and drive business growth.




Founded with a focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, Ratepay offers a comprehensive suite of payment solutions tailored to the needs of modern e-commerce businesses. From flexible installment options to seamless checkout experiences, Ratepay's solutions are designed to increase conversion rates, reduce cart abandonment, and foster long-term customer loyalty.




Your mission




Risk management is at the core of Ratepay’s business strategy. Our cutting-edge risk management platform processes hundreds of thousands of transactions daily, ensuring secure payments for our merchants and their customers while minimizing risk and maximizing profitability.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Full-Stack Data Scientist to take a leading role in enhancing our fraud prevention and credit risk assessment capabilities. This role involves researching, developing, and deploying advanced machine learning algorithms into production. You will be responsible for every aspect of the data science process, from data collection and pre-processing to building and deploying machine learning models, as well as developing and maintaining production-level codebases.

In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and ensure that our solutions are scalable and reliable in a fast-paced environment.




Your tasks at Ratepay, among others




Lead the research, development and implementation of advanced machine learning models for credit risk assessment and fraud prevention.
Own data science projects end-to-end, i.e. from ideation and proof of concept to bringing it into production.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code adhering to best engineering practices for data processing, model development, and deployment, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Pre-process complex financial data and create ETL pipelines to support machine learning models.
Continuously improve our machine learning workflows, research, and deployment pipelines, ensuring best practices and innovation.
Collaborate closely with team members and cross-functional teams, utilizing strong communication skills to develop robust machine learning solutions.
Take ownership of subcomponents of the machine learning infrastructure, ensuring their performance and scalability as the platform evolves.







That's what you bring along




5 + years of experience working with the whole data science product cycle: conception, research, prototyping, modelling, deployment to production
Master’s degree in STEM field
Very good engineering skills in Python and familiarity with clean code (pre-commit, black, code reviews etc.), unit testing (pytest) and type hints (mypy).
General understanding of SQL and SQL databases. Ability to retrieve data and build data pipelines that feed models in research and (ideally) build pipelines for production.
Advanced knowledge of statistical learning theory and its application to solve real-world problems.
Strong stakeholder communication skills with the ability to clearly present ideas, solutions and findings.




Nice to have:




MLOps and experience on AWS Cloud
Experience in Fintech







Equal Opportunities & Diversity

We value our diversity and welcome everyone to our team. Regardless of ethnic and social background, religious views, worldview, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental limitations, age, marital status, educational background and nationality. With over 250 employees and 40 different nationalities, we take our values seriously. These include; ownership, growth, integrity, collaboration, customer centricity and inclusion (4/6 of our C-Level Board members are female).

Title: Principal Engineer, Deep Learning
Description:
The Company

Outrider is a software company that is automating distribution yards with electric, self-driving trucks. Our system eliminates manual tasks that are hazardous and repetitive while it improves safety and efficiency. Outrider’s mission is to drive the rapid adoption of sustainable freight transportation. We are a private company founded in 2018 and backed by NEA, 8VC, Koch Disruptive Technologies, NVIDIA, and other top-tier investors. Our customers are Fortune 200 companies and our autonomous trucks are already running in distribution yards. For more information, visit www.outrider.ai

At Outrider, you'll develop, improve upon, and ship cutting-edge software that drives next-generation freight transportation. Your work will directly contribute to autonomous systems that move millions of tons of freight across shipping & logistics centers, revolutionizing the way goods are transported globally. Over time, your contributions will enhance efficiency, safety, precision, and sustainability across the supply chain. Throughout your time at Outrider, you'll collaborate across teams and functions to build and maintain robust systems that keep the global economy moving.

The Role

Outrider is an ambitious company that aims to solve autonomous vehicles for yard/warehouse operation. We are building a special electric truck that can achieve complex maneuvers in huge warehouses, among traffic, people and other complicated settings. This is not your generic autonomous vehicle product: we have a specific setting, specific hardware and specific customers.

We have great financial backing, a clear product in mind and a highly competent engineering team. Now, we want to expand on critical hires.

We are looking for a Principal ML/Deep Learning Engineer that is able to steer and execute the technical strategy for our deep learning stack in our autonomous vehicle. You will work with a great engineering team that is highly motivated to make this a reality and a leadership that is laser focused on a product.

Duties & Responsibilities


Devise solutions and design neural networks for perception that run online on our autonomous vehicle
Provide technical and theoretical guidance to the deep learning team
Communicate and distill evaluations and results to the leadership
Help to design/improve our key deep learning tools: data, evaluation, compute
Lead cross functional efforts with respect to interfacing with the other autonomy
consumers and upstream/downstream components



Required Qualifications


Bachelor/Master in CS or equivalent
Three years of engineering experience in deep learning oriented teams
Mastering modern DL and python-related frameworks: Pytorch/Tensor Flow, Numpy, Scikit.
Familiar with respect to DL state of the art, practices and recent research
Able to design ML models from scratch: problem definition, data, model bring-up, debugging, evaluation and deployment
Excellent communication skills for leadership and stakeholders



Compensation & Benefits


Salary: $250,000 - $400,000
Equity: Significant equity package commensurate on experience and skills
Benefits: Full health benefits
Fully remote, with exciting opportunities to travel to our Denver headquarters for team collaborations and special events.
Home office stipend up to $500 to help you create a comfortable and productive workspace.
Actual compensation is based on several factors, including but not limited to job-related skills, qualifications, experience, and specific work location due to differences in the cost of labor



$250,000 - $400,000 a year

Actual compensation is based on several factors, including but not limited to job-related skills, qualifications, experience, and specific work location due to differences in the cost of labor

At Outrider, we believe in cultivating an environment where there is diversity of perspectives, experiences, and knowledge with the expectation that we thrive in an inclusive environment. Outrider is committed to a workforce where everyone's opportunities are limitless regardless of race, national origin, gender, age, religion, disability, veteran status, or any others that are protected by law.

To protect yourself against the increasing number of recruiting scams, please make sure that you are communicating with Outrider Technologies, Inc. or one of its employees. The only way to communicate with us is through our corporate website at www.outrider.ai , through corporate emails utilizing our domain name of @ outrider.ai , and through our job board at jobs.lever.co/outrider . Be vigilant when checking domains because imitators often make very small changes to trick the eye. Additionally, please know that Outrider does not use text messaging or public messaging platforms, such as Telegram or Whatsapp, to communicate with candidates and Outrider will never ask an employment candidate for financial information or for payment of any kind.

Title: Data Scientist (£70-81k)
Description:
! We are not working with recruiters on this role !

Sequel is a community of the world's best athletes investing in the world's best startups, making a positive impact.

We are on a mission to help athletes build legacies for their families and for the world.

We are a seed-stage company founded and backed by experienced serial entrepreneurs with several successful exits.

A world-class team is looking for a world-class full-time Data Scientist to help us build and improve our data tools to make better investment decisions.

What You Will Be Working On


Implement tools that surface trends in the investment world
Strengthen our data-driven methods of identifying startups
Create tools that let us apply the data insights you generate



We are here to win - not just to take part. Just like our clients who operate at the elite level of sport, we understand that in order to win; we need to put in the work. This means going the extra mile, being willing to do what others will not and holding ourselves to a higher standard. Some companies play to not lose, we play to win. We are proactive, decisive and have the courage to take risks.

We pay it forward - we are always helpful. To customers, to partners and most importantly to each other. Not because it will ‘pay back', because it's the right thing to do.

We are adaptable - we understand in a world that is changing faster than ever before - the only constant is change. The average lifespan of a Fortune 100 company in 1958 was 61 years, now it is 18 years. We adapt to a changing world, constantly iterating, moving forward and staying relevant.

Yes first - we are on a mission to build something which has never been done before from the ground up. It will be a hard journey full of challenges which are currently unsolved. Our culture is defined by the fact that when we are confronted with challenges, we work from the assumption that it is possible to overcome them.

We are transparent - we challenge each other. Regardless of title, seniority or reporting lines. We give feedback and we are hungry to receive it. We value honest feedback delivered with kindness, and we value people who ask questions.

We always trust, respect and care for each other - it's no easy feat working in a startup, let alone one with goals as ambitious as ours. At sequel we believe no one is ever too busy to support fellow team members and that we should always be helpful, inclusive and selfless in the way we work. Diversity of background and thought is celebrated as we respect and appreciate what makes us all different. We don't tolerate free riders, egos or workplace politics.

Requirements

🏆 Who You Are


You are interested in data science and research but also in applying your insights
You previously worked in the field of VC/hedge fund data or data scraping
You know TypeScript, python is a big plus
Bonus: experience with Retool
Bonus: You know your way around Firebase and GCP
An avid learner constantly exploring new technologies and tinkering with LLMs & vector databases
You have a big interest in building systems that handle millions of data records
You don't shy away from making data come to life working on the back- or if necessary also the frontend
A brilliant communicator - you are not afraid to tell if something is going in the wrong direction and you want to correct early on
You have an existing passion for or an interest in learning more about the worlds of startup investing and professional sport



Benefits


💰 Meaningful options package
🏥 Private healthcare
🧘 We offer perks through Juno, a holistic perks platform
🍼 Generous parental leave policy
🏢 We believe our best work is done together in the office, but we offer flexibility for team members to work up to 1 day per week at home
💻 Choose your own equipment
🏝 25 days off + bank holidays
📚 £500 per year learning and development budget
🏋️ Gym Membership Contributions
Show more
HTML:
! We are not working with recruiters on this role !

Sequel is a community of the world's best athletes investing in the world's best startups, making a positive impact.

We are on a mission to help athletes build legacies for their families and for the world.

We are a seed-stage company founded and backed by experienced serial entrepreneurs with several successful exits.

A world-class team is looking for a world-class full-time Data Scientist to help us build and improve our data tools to make better investment decisions.

What You Will Be Working On

  • Implement tools that surface trends in the investment world
  • Strengthen our data-driven methods of identifying startups
  • Create tools that let us apply the data insights you generate


We are here to win - not just to take part. Just like our clients who operate at the elite level of sport, we understand that in order to win; we need to put in the work. This means going the extra mile, being willing to do what others will not and holding ourselves to a higher standard. Some companies play to not lose, we play to win. We are proactive, decisive and have the courage to take risks.

We pay it forward - we are always helpful. To customers, to partners and most importantly to each other. Not because it will ‘pay back', because it's the right thing to do.

We are adaptable - we understand in a world that is changing faster than ever before - the only constant is change. The average lifespan of a Fortune 100 company in 1958 was 61 years, now it is 18 years. We adapt to a changing world, constantly iterating, moving forward and staying relevant.

Yes first - we are on a mission to build something which has never been done before from the ground up. It will be a hard journey full of challenges which are currently unsolved. Our culture is defined by the fact that when we are confronted with challenges, we work from the assumption that it is possible to overcome them.

We are transparent - we challenge each other. Regardless of title, seniority or reporting lines. We give feedback and we are hungry to receive it. We value honest feedback delivered with kindness, and we value people who ask questions.

We always trust, respect and care for each other - it's no easy feat working in a startup, let alone one with goals as ambitious as ours. At sequel we believe no one is ever too busy to support fellow team members and that we should always be helpful, inclusive and selfless in the way we work. Diversity of background and thought is celebrated as we respect and appreciate what makes us all different. We don't tolerate free riders, egos or workplace politics.

Requirements

🏆 Who You Are

  • You are interested in data science and research but also in applying your insights
  • You previously worked in the field of VC/hedge fund data or data scraping
  • You know TypeScript, python is a big plus
  • Bonus: experience with Retool
  • Bonus: You know your way around Firebase and GCP
  • An avid learner constantly exploring new technologies and tinkering with LLMs & vector databases
  • You have a big interest in building systems that handle millions of data records
  • You don't shy away from making data come to life working on the back- or if necessary also the frontend
  • A brilliant communicator - you are not afraid to tell if something is going in the wrong direction and you want to correct early on
  • You have an existing passion for or an interest in learning more about the worlds of startup investing and professional sport


Benefits

  • 💰 Meaningful options package
  • 🏥 Private healthcare
  • 🧘 We offer perks through Juno, a holistic perks platform
  • 🍼 Generous parental leave policy
  • 🏢 We believe our best work is done together in the office, but we offer flexibility for team members to work up to 1 day per week at home
  • 💻 Choose your own equipment
  • 🏝 25 days off + bank holidays
  • 📚 £500 per year learning and development budget
  • 🏋️ Gym Membership Contributions

Title: Data Science Graduate
Description:
Company Description

Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?

Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world?

You’ll fit right in.

Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.

Think you know us?

Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

Individuality fuels our brand and our global team — we’re proud to be a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. We understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office: whether it’s taking advantage of agile working schedules or our wellness programmes, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone. In addition, we offer market-leading compensation and have a fantastic benefits offering.

So, if you’re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness.

Job Description

What we expect of you, day to day:

The Data Scientist graduate is a key member of the client facing Data Science Lab team in the European region. As a Data Scientist, you will be accountable for the development and delivery of analytics driven strategies and solutions for Visa’s external clients in Europe. In this role, you will work collaboratively with VCA and a multitude of internal functions, their senior leaders and our clients in promoting insights driven culture, creative and cutting edge analytic solutions and best practices to drive business performance with a clear commercial ‘value’ and measurable ‘return’. Half of your day will involve delivering project (coding/working with data) and the other half will be dedicated to discussing data requirements, managing internal and external meetings. Please bear in mind that our workload varies tremendously given each project is very bespoke, sometimes we might be delivering a csv file, another time a predictive machine learning model or segmentation. Whatever the solution is, you will be involved in the end to end process starting from gathering clients requirements all the way to delivering actionable insight enabling our clients to make data driven business decisions.

Principal Responsibilities


Evangelizes the creative use of data science to solve business problems with external clients 
Works with VCA consultants in market to drive data science business development opportunities across key accounts to meet VCA revenue targets
Applies data science and predictive techniques that can be used to enhance client profitability across acquisition and retention
Works with VCA consultants on conducting VisaNet data analysis on key metrics in order to articulate key issuer P&L opportunities to drive revenue growth for our clients and Visa
Create and deliver powerful business-centric insights from data through better visualization and storyboarding
Collaborating with the internal and external partners to fully understand business requirements and desired business outcomes
Execution proficiency in handling multiple medium to large data science projects along with rest of the stakeholders in the project team
Defining detailed analytic scope and methodology, and creating analytic plans
Executing on the analytic plans with appropriate data mining and statistical techniques
Ensuring project delivery within timelines and budget requirements
Ensuring all project documentation is up to date and all projects are reviewed per analytic plan
Enhancing existing solutions and approaches by promoting new methodology and best practices in data science field
Providing subject matter expertise and quality assurance of complex data science projects
Automating processes/codes
Familiarising yourself with new tools/software/techniques


Qualifications

What we’re after…


Graduate/Post Graduate degree (Masters or Ph.D.) in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Computer Science, Economics, or engineering or equivalent experience .
Graduating in 2025.
Results oriented with strong analytical, consultative and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
Familiarity with modern distributed systems, including both Hadoop/SQL/MLP and Apache Spark etc.
Familiarity with one or more data analytics/programming tools such as R or Python
Knowledge of applying predictive modelling and machine learning technique to problems
Ability to communicate with impact and interest in working in a consulting-like environment and client-facing project roles


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
Show more

  • Enhancing existing solutions and approaches by promoting new methodology and best practices in data science field
  • Providing subject matter expertise and quality assurance of complex data science projects
  • Automating processes/codes
  • Familiarising yourself with new tools/software/techniques

Qualifications

What we’re after…

  • Graduate/Post Graduate degree (Masters or Ph.D.) in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Computer Science, Economics, or engineering or equivalent experience .
  • Graduating in 2025.
  • Results oriented with strong analytical, consultative and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
  • Familiarity with modern distributed systems, including both Hadoop/SQL/MLP and Apache Spark etc.
  • Familiarity with one or more data analytics/programming tools such as R or Python
  • Knowledge of applying predictive modelling and machine learning technique to problems
  • Ability to communicate with impact and interest in working in a consulting-like environment and client-facing project roles

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Title: Junior Data Scientist （Graduate Scheme）
Description:
Role: Data Scientist/Senior Data Scientist

Location: London + Flexible/Hybrid working

Salary: Depends on experience

About Envision:

Envision stands as a global leader in renewable energy and net zero technologies, serving as an Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) for wind turbines, lithium-ion batteries, utility-scale storage, hydrogen electrolysers, and synthesizers. Additionally, we are a provider of Artificial Intelligence of Things (AIoT) technology, contributing to a more sustainable future.

Renowned for our innovation, Envision is consistently ranked among the world's smartest companies and recognized as a leader in transformative initiatives with a "Change the World" distinction. Our commitment extends to the creation of net zero industrial parks and fostering an ecosystem of innovation. Our passion lies in shaping a world where sustainable solutions go beyond mere targets, becoming a tangible reality.

About the role:

To propel our product innovation through the strategic extraction of valuable insights from data, we are seeking a skilled Data Scientist to join our collaborative development team. This role places you at the cutting edge of product evolution, where you will actively engage in the dynamic process of discovery and development alongside our clients. Your mission is to delve deep into client challenges and the expansive solution space, utilizing your expertise in data wrangling, analytical modelling, and machine learning. We invite you to leverage your curiosity and creativity to distil crucial values from raw battery data, contributing to the continuous enhancement of our ground-breaking products.

Responsibilities:

Your Core Responsibilities:

Harness the power of raw battery data: Extract valuable insights and translate them into actionable decisions that drive positive outcomes.
Bring ideas to life: Champion promising solutions and shepherd them through the entire agile development cycle, from initial concept to full-fledged data and software products that scale effectively.
Become a trusted advisor: Collaborate closely with clients, leveraging data-driven approaches to develop solutions that address their specific challenges and unlock new possibilities.
Foster a collaborative environment: Work hand-in-hand with Product Management, UX Design, and Engineering teams to continuously analyse the solution landscape and assess the impact of ongoing development initiatives and innovative ideas.
Beyond these core responsibilities, you will also have the opportunity to:
Lead the charge: Guide fellow battery data scientists in tackling both immediate and long-term data analysis needs.
Shape the future: Contribute to the development of cutting-edge battery analytics products, including robust data pipelines and state-of-the-art algorithms for accurate battery health and state estimation.
Bridge the gap: Translate complex technical concepts into clear and actionable insights for both internal and external stakeholders.
Become a strategic thinker: Assist in crafting the long-term roadmap for battery analytics, ensuring Envision Group remains at the forefront of this rapidly evolving field.
Think outside the box: Conceptualise and prototype novel algorithms, applying analytical and machine learning methods to unlock the hidden potential within raw battery data.
Build valuable relationships: Engage with diverse stakeholders across the organization and beyond, leveraging data to develop solutions that address their unique challenges.
Stay ahead of the curve: Partner with Product Development and Engineering teams to continuously analyze the evolving solution space and assess the impact of ongoing development initiatives and innovative ideas.

Qualification and expertise:




Fundamental knowledge of battery science.
MSc/MEng or PhD in Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent.
Portfolio of projects demonstrating applied machine learning experience.
Strong mathematical mindset and ability.
Strong coding ability in Python (required) and SQL (desirable). Experience working with one or more of R, Scala and Java will be advantageous.
Fluent in English.
Strong communication and cross-cultural interpersonal skills.
A fast learner, with a ‘can-do’ attitude.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Scientist
Description:
We’re looking for a data scientist/analyst to join our small and growing team to continue building our data processes and help build our product further. As part of the data team at elm you can expect to own large parts of the data product, learn fast and grow as elm does, and work directly with large customers directly on their most exciting opportunities.

What you’ll do:


Support with internal data processes and take the lead on ensuring all data connections are live and active
Develop new data features and improve existing ones to help FMCG brands harness their data
Develop internal tools and processes to ensure data infrastructure is working to its utmost capability
Work with extensive datasets in the retail sector to create and implement data science solutions for the industry
Help users solve issues and respond to their feedback
Work alongside our engineering, product, and sales teams to develop and implement data products


Requirements

About you:


You have at least 1 year experience working as a data analyst or scientist
You’re very well-versed in SQL and Python
You have experience working with data systems and architecture such as AWS, DBT, or similar
You're confident both getting stuck in with data processes and tasks but also thinking strategically about how data can help drive businesses forward
You care about success and growing professionally
You’re well organised and a strong communicator


Benefits

What we can offer you:


Starting salary of £30-35k
Share options: the chance to own a part of elm
Flexible working. We trust you to do your job well at times that suit you (hours and location)
Ownership: the chance to build a product from scratch, define elm’s future, and reap the rewards when we succeed
28 days holiday (plus bank holidays)


Note: we're a London based company but are ~90% remote (we like to try meet up regularly for in person sessions). The ideal candidate will be within 1 hour of the UK timezone.

A Little About The Application Process

To manage your expectations, the following is the 5 main steps of our application process:


Application review
Phone/zoom interview
Practical exercise (max 2-3 hours of your own time)
Further team interviews
Final discussion / offer


We want to work with great people who care

If you’re not sure you match the criteria but you want to be a part of our mission and you like the sound of jumping in at ground level, we want to hear from you. We also believe that diverse teams make better things, so we’d especially like to hear from you if you come from a background that’s traditionally underrepresented in tech.
Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Harmonic Security, a cutting-edge startup with joint headquarters in the UK and US, is leading the charge in data protection for the future. We're on a mission to empower organizations to leverage the power of generative AI, without compromising security or privacy.

As our Data Scientist, you'll be a critical member of our team, laying the groundwork for groundbreaking advancements in secure Generative AI adoption. Your expertise will be instrumental in building high-quality datasets that fuel our innovative models.

Here's where you'll make a significant impact:


Working collaboratively to design and curate comprehensive datasets tailored to train and fine-tune our sensitive data detection models
Your keen eye and meticulous approach will ensure data accuracy and completeness, a vital foundation for robust and reliable models
You'll stay abreast of the latest data science trends and techniques, continuously seeking ways to optimize dataset creation to enhance model performance
You'll collaborate effectively with engineers and security teams, fostering clear communication around data needs and ensuring seamless integration with our security solutions


You'll be directly contributing to the development of groundbreaking technology that empowers secure Generative AI adoption within enterprises.

Requirements

This role is a great fit for someone with:


Models running in production and integrated into a live product
A proven track record of building and managing high-quality datasets
A desire to work in a fast-paced, innovative environment
A product driven mindset with a focus on incremental delivery
Expert knowledge of Python and relevant libraries
Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques
Excellent communication and collaboration skills



Bonus points if you have:


Experience building systems that utilise generative AI models
Experience working in the data security domain
Strong understanding of classification approaches and models
Strong understanding of data categorization techniques and taxonomies
Been in front of customers and/or end-users to build a complete understanding of the problem domain
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)



Benefits

Harmonic Security offers a competitive package:


Competitive Salary & Health: Market-rate salary with private healthcare & dental
Startup Culture: Be part of a dynamic team with innovation at its core
Continuous Learning: Develop your skills with training programs and industry resources
Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a flexible hybrid work environment (office is based in Kings Cross)
Shared Success: Everyone holds stock options, where we all share in the success of the company
Show more
